isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - SINGLE REDUCTION AXLES WITH CONTROLLED TRACTION DIFFERENTIALS: EATON - LUBRICATION - DRIVER-CONTROLLED CTD SHIFT UNIT

svcprocinfo.para:
The driver-controlled type traction differential is usually engaged and disengaged by an air shift unit, operated from the vehicle cab. For details, refer to CTD SHIFT SYSTEM
.

svcsubproc.title: Shift Unit Lubrication
svcsubproc.para: Use SAE 10 motor oil* for temperatures above 0°F (-18°C). For temperatures below 0°F (-18°C), mix three parts of SAE 10 motor oil with one part of kerosene. This cold weather mixture can be safely used up to 32°F (0°C).

note.para: Commercially available automatic transmission fluid may be used in place of SAE 10 motor oil. Automatic transmission fluid can be used for all temperatures. Do not mix kerosene with automatic transmission fluid.

svcsubproc.title: Lubricant Check and Level
svcsubproc.para: Each 20,000 miles or 6 months, remove pipe plug in shift unit housing cover to check lubricant level. Oil should be level with bottom of filler hole.

svcsubproc.title: Lubricant Change
svcsubproc.para: At least once a year, remove shift unit housing cover and drain old lubricant. Wash parts thoroughly and air dry. Reinstall cover. Remove pipe plug in cover. Fill through pipe plug opening until lubricant is level with bottom of filler hole.
